result.execSummary:
The defendant Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Discharge Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
-Complete an anger management class.
-Complete Batterers Intervention class;
Defendant informed he may not possess any firearms or body armor.

-Pay mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 4-12-2024;
-Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error, added firearm restriction.

Defendant Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 1:30 pm for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail review. Arguments heard.  Court denied defense to modify bail.  Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Antwonnay Strowder
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Khalil Trayvon-DeKendre Ealy.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
